questions.question: What is the purpose of the HTML Geolocation API?

options.C: To enable drag and drop functionality

questions.explanation: The HTML Geolocation API is used to retrieve the geographical position of a user's device.

questions.question: Which method is used to get the current location of a user in the Geolocation API?
questions.explanation: The `getCurrentPosition()` method of the Geolocation API is used to get the current location of the user.

questions.question: What does the HTML Drag and Drop API enable?

options.B: Moving elements within or between web pages

questions.explanation: The HTML Drag and Drop API allows users to drag and drop elements on a web page, either within the same page or between different pages/applications.

questions.question: Which event is triggered when an element is dragged using the HTML Drag and Drop API?
questions.explanation: The `ondrag` event is fired when an element or text selection is being dragged (every few hundred milliseconds).

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the HTML Web Storage API?

options.A: To store data in the cloud
options.B: To store data on the user's local device

questions.explanation: The HTML Web Storage API provides mechanisms for web applications to store data locally within the user's browser.

questions.question: Which Web Storage method is used to store data that persists until the browser or tab is closed?
questions.explanation: `sessionStorage` stores data for only one session, meaning it's available as long as the browser tab or window is open, and is cleared when the tab/window is closed.

questions.question: What is the purpose of HTML Web Workers?

options.A: To handle drag and drop actions
options.B: To run JavaScript in the background

questions.explanation: HTML Web Workers allow web applications to run scripts in background threads, independent of the main execution thread, thus improving performance.

questions.question: Which HTML API allows scripts to continue working in the background, independent of other scripts?
questions.explanation: The Web Workers API enables running scripts in the background without interfering with the responsiveness of the page.

questions.question: What does SSE stand for in HTML?
questions.explanation: SSE stands for Server-Sent Events, which is an HTML5 API for pushing real-time updates from a server to a client.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Server-Sent Events (SSE) in HTML?

options.A: To send files to the server
options.B: To allow a server to push updates to the client

questions.explanation: Server-Sent Events (SSE) enable a server to push data to a client in real-time over a single HTTP connection, allowing for live updates without the client constantly polling the server.
